If you have a car, you can use it to get everywhere in and around Moss Vale.

If you don't.  The town shopping centre is easily walkable.  But there isn't much there, and it isn't really a tourist attraction in its own right.

You can bicycle around town and easily get out to the river, Bong Bong, and even to

(around 10km).

value: content=A 5km cycleway follows the Wingecarribee River past the historic location of the Bong Bong township.  Not much of the old township remains, but the cycleway by the side of the river is flat, and pleasant.  You can bring a bike from Sydney on the  train. The cycleway extends to the station at Burradoo.

content=Busy Thai restaurant, popular with locals.  Eat in or take away.  BYO.

There are a couple of pubs in the centre of town.  Well patronised by a mostly local crowd on Friday and Saturday nights.
There is good mobile reception on all networks in Moss Vale.
